law.catch_line: The Administration may file a notice of a child support lien with the clerk of a circuit court....

text.section: The Administration may file a notice of a child support lien with the clerk of a circuit court.

section.section:
On receipt of a notice of a child support lien, the clerk of a circuit court shall:
record and index the lien; and
enter the lien in the judgment docket of the court.

The docket entry shall include:
the name of the person whose property is subject to the child support lien; and
the amount and date of the child support lien.
From the date on which a child support lien is filed, the child support lien has the full force and effect of a judgment lien.
A child support lien established under this Part IV of this subtitle may be enforced in accordance with the Maryland Rules.
